body_html: @drpngx Actually on second thought, I think calling reset_default_graph() after reset() is a good idea. reset_default_graph() may do extra things in the future. Calling it gets rid of the need to track those future changes here. I made some further revision to add that and to make the comments clearer.
body_text: @drpngx Actually on second thought, I think calling reset_default_graph() after reset() is a good idea. reset_default_graph() may do extra things in the future. Calling it gets rid of the need to track those future changes here. I made some further revision to add that and to make the comments clearer.
body: @drpngx Actually on second thought, I think calling reset_default_graph() after reset() is a good idea. reset_default_graph() may do extra things in the future. Calling it gets rid of the need to track those future changes here. I made some further revision to add that and to make the comments clearer.
